ingredients: 2 Tbsp fresh herbs (basil, thyme, or chives), chopped
steps: Roast cherry tomatoes on a baking sheet for 15 minutes at 400F
Heat 2 Tbsp olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, 3-4 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute until fragrant
Add roasted tomatoes, oregano, basil, salt, pepper, vinegar, mustard, lemon juice, and sugar if using. Simmer 2-3 minutes to meld flavors. Stir in capers and chickpeas if using. Remove from heat
For crispy topping - choose one method:
> Method 1 (pre-toasted): In same skillet, toast panko in 1 Tbsp olive oil over medium heat, stirring constantly, until golden brown (3-4 minutes). Transfer to bowl and mix with lemon zest and herbs
> Method 2 (simpler): Mix panko with 1 Tbsp olive oil, lemon zest, and herbs in a bowl

Spread about 1/3 of the tomato mixture in the bottom of a casserole dish big enough to fit all fillets without overlapping. Lay fish fillets over tomato mixture, then spoon remaining tomatoes over top
Sprinkle breadcrumb mixture evenly over each fillet
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until fish reaches 145F internal temperature and flakes easily. If topping isn ’ t golden, broil for 1-2 minutes watching carefully
Serve hot with lemon wedges and extra fresh herbs
title: Oven Baked White Fish With Tomatoes
